page.title: 01GOVAN, A DIVIDED DISTRICT
page.content: This block of S.W. Glasgow is dissected by several major roads, including a motorway, producing a network of small communities, all of which have a district character and inhabitants mutually suspicious of each other. Many teenagers cross into other districts,seen as foreign territory, only with a crowd of friends. Even within each area there are local differences with 'nice' streets and 'rough' streets. These minute social distinctions are unobservable to a visitor, shopping in the streets servicing the locals, relaxing in the parks or determinedly travelling to the city centre by road or rail. Many of the locals are more familiar with the city centre than the district adjacent to them, which can be as remote as another town.
